entry.title: [PriceDrop] Show module on cold startup
entry.content:
Currently, the ShoppingPersistedTabDataService is not properly

initialized because the attempt of initialization happens too early

that the tab model may not be ready yet. This CL fixes this issue by

postponing the initialization until the tab model is ready. Based

on local testing, this fix doesn't lead to PriceChangeModule being

timeout and gets rejected by MagicStack.

entry.title: [UNO] Support Sign in paused - PeopleHandler
entry.content:
With Uno the primary account should be set/cleared with explicit user

action.



The people handler on signout:

- Shows Gaia logout tab

- If a primary account with sync still exists, it invokes sync.



This relies on:

- In case of signin primary account,

`DiceResponseHandler::ProcessDiceSignoutHeader` will revoke all

tokens on signout.

- On revoke sync consent, the `SigninManager` will clear all accounts if

the accounts in the Gaia cookie is empty (/Logout).



These assumptions will be broken on follow-up CLs with:

- `SigninManager` no longer created in the Full Uno experiment

- Signout from the web only invalidated the primary account.



This CL ensures on Signout from Chrome Setting, the primary account is

removed. On next reconciliation cycle, the `AccountReconcilor` will

match the refresh tokens to the accounts in the Gaia cookie. As the

\Logout + \ListAccounts are network requests, it is expected the account

reconcilor will run after the primary account is removed.



Bug: b/319402216

Change-Id: If8edfdf0d21d6e50ac102d6776144d74bd90a2f9

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5307136

Commit-Queue: Monica Basta

Reviewed-by: David Roger

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1263325}

entry.title: [Android TRM] Fix crash from bad ModuleDelegate calls.
entry.content:
The Magic Stack callbacks

onDataReady()

onDataFetchFailed()



helps the framework decide whether or not to show a module. For each

module there should only be one invocation total.



Tab Resumption Module's recently integrated with Magic Stack, but didn't

follow the above constraint. Direct causes:

1. ForeignSessionTabResumptionDataProvider: The ForeignSessionHelper use

followed "Recent Tab" feature's example of doing both sync (to read

cached data if no new data) and async (to receive new data if

available) reads. Thus read and downstream updates can happen twice.

In some cases, both callbacks above are invoked (e.g., initially no

foreign tabs exist, then open NTP 1, then new foreign tab is opened,

then open NTP 2).

* The async listener can fire for later updates. This is undesirable

since the TRM currently does have dynamic refresh, except for

handling login / sync status changes.

2. TabResumptionModuleMediator: loadModule() naively calls onDataReady()

when suggestions are available, and onDataFetchFailed() otherwise;

there's no restrictions on repeated callback invocation.

* These calls happen after processing and rendering -- it might be

more efficient to call earlier.



Meanwhile, here's an existing Magic Stack issue:

3. If a module calls onDataFetchFailed(), it gets hidden, but there's

no guarantee that cleanup (via hideModule()) gets executed, even

after NTP closes (despite crrev.com/5304099).



The above combine to cause a crashing bug:



(3) causes ForeignSessionTabResumptionDataProvider to leak, along with a

stale HomeModulesMediator. From (1), the async data listener is active,

and it fires if a remote tabs updates happens and another NTP opens.

From (2), onDataReady() gets called, causing stale HomeModulesMediator

retrieve empty data, resulting in null object reference.



Fixing any of the above would prevent the crash, but it's best to

address them all. This CL makes simple fixes to (1) and (2):

* ForeignSessionTabResumptionDataProvider: Remove async load. This

solution also avoids downstream processing complexity, although the

TRM becomes less responsive to updates, since new data fetched from

triggerSessionSync() is likely unavailable to getForeignSessions()

call for the current module. Removing async load also prevents

multiple async updates.

* TabResumptionModuleMediator: Add |mHasPreviousLoad| to ensure that the

callbacks are only called once. Also move the call before render.



Issue (3) will be fixed separately by hanxi@.



Bug: 1515325, 325641882

Change-Id: Ib38ec1cf9fde6d3383d84d94f707fab2dea71ef5

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5309645

Reviewed-by: Xi Han

Commit-Queue: Samuel Huang

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1263323}

entry.title: Fuzzing coverage timing & retry tweaks.
entry.content:
The fuzzing coverage dashboard currently takes 4.8 hours to run all the

fuzzers, but fails to gather coverage for the MojoLPM fuzzers. This CL

is an attempt to adjust some of the timeouts and retry limits to

(hopefully) achieve better coverage collection within the same sort of

time limit.



The overall algorithm (unchanged) is:

* Try to run the fuzzer against its whole corpus, retrying

* If that doesn't work, run it against individual test cases, until

we've gathered 'n' traces successfully, or attempted 'm' traces



This CL:

* Increases 'n' from 10 to 100. This is what seems to be needed to

gather coverage from most of our MojoLPM fuzzers. (100 is just a

guess). This will obviously increase the time taken for the job.

* Decreases 'm' from 1000 to 500, which will save some time but will

likely only impact two fuzzers, so won't save much.

* Decreases the retries on the initial whole-corpus run from 2 to 1

because there's no evidence that retries actually help anyway.

* Decreases the timeout for each individual-test-case run from 30

minutes to 1 minute. I don't think we're currently hitting this

timeout so this probably won't make any difference.

* Decreases the timeout for the whole-corpus run from 30 minutes

to 20 minutes. This is being hit 67 times at the moment - it's

not clear whether this is because these fuzzers are stalled or

because it's just taking a long time to run them. So this is a

bit of a gamble - this could reduce overall execution time (if the

former) or increase it (if the latter, and we then have to run

more test cases individually.)



Bug: 326191164, 326192741

Change-Id: Ic9af0bbb22c976e06ea3b78480d4aaefde8d5210

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5310025

entry.title: Reland "Reland "[ Companion ] Migrate Companion pref into PinnedActionsToolbarModel Fix""
entry.content:
See changes between patchset 1 and 2. This was reverted due to

CompanionUtilsTest failing on ChromeOS. This stops those tests from

being run on ChromeOS were companion is off.



This is a reland of commit e10bd68dfb6b4aafebc631d37d704bf18ed85981



Original change's description:

> Reland "[ Companion ] Migrate Companion pref into PinnedActionsToolbarModel Fix"

>

> See Patchset 1 vs 2 for what has changed from original cl. To fix

> crashing checks were added to companion related code in

> PinnedToolbarActionsContainer and SidePanelToolbarContainer to make sure

> the companion feature is enabled before attempting to trigger the

> companion migration. This was likely causing the crashing since it

> appeared the majority of crash instances had side panel pinning with

> responsive toolbar enabled but not companion. Also update any added

> checks for the kSidePanelPinning flag to instead use

> IsSidePanelPinningEnabled method which also checks the chrome refresh.

>

> This is a reland of commit 58df1606dcc1ab89958c0d38ce7cb542aa9a4a65

>

> Original change's description:

> > [ Companion ] Migrate Companion pref into PinnedActionsToolbarModel Fix

> >

> > Fixes a bug where the migration of the

> > `kSidePanelCompanionEntryPinnedToToolbar` profile pref only happened on

> > startup / instantiation of the PinnedToolbarActionsModel even though

> > the pref could be changed at any point during a browser's session.

> >

> > To fix this, we call the migration code any time

> > CompanionUtils::UpdateCompanionDefaultPinnedToolbarState is called.

> > This will attempt to migrate the pref into the

> > PinnedToolbarActionsModel, if it hasn't already. All current callers

> > at the time this was written are covered by this change.

entry.title: [Quick Delete] Fix crash in tab closure
entry.content:
There is a crash in the TabModelImpl.closeMultipleTabs due to tabs

not in the model getting closed with QD. This could be due to the delay

between when the tabs are filtered (before clearing browsing data) to

when they are closed after clearing browsing data (Which could lead to

some delays). Any closure of the tabs or switching of the tab model

during this delay would result in a crash.



This change moves the tab lookup to right when the animation is

triggered/tabs will be closed.

entry.title: Create the CertificateProvisioningServiceFactory
entry.content:
This factory ties the whole managed identities structure together by

constructing all of the main components and injecting the right

dependencies. When created, the CertificateProvisioningService will

start watching for policy changes (via observing pref values) and only

take action when certain policies are enabled. That behavior, coupled

with the overwriting of ServiceIsCreatedWithBrowserContext, will allow

the provisioning process to bootstrap itself along with the

instantiation of a Profile. The whole process is not yet supported on

OTR Profiles.

entry.title: Add GPU host_information
entry.content:
Adds a host_information module used for determining information

about the host that the Python test harness is running on. This

is meant for use cases where a browser is not available to pull

tags from. Since this is specifically for the host, it does not

work for remote platforms such as Android or ChromeOS.



Currently, OS type, CPU architecture, and GPU vendor are

supported information.



Concrete list of changes:

1. Adds the host_information module

2. Adds an info_collection test case to verify that the

information provided by this module matches what is provided

by the browser.

3. Changes most existing uses of sys.platform to use

host_information instead.

4. Makes use of CPU and GPU information to restrict test

serializations to only the configurations that actually

need them.



Bug: 324293876

entry.title: Prevent crash calling setDeviceMetricsOverride on autoresize window
entry.content:
Emulation.setDeviceMetricsOverride goes through a series of calls

leading to WebFrameWidgetImpl::SetScreenInfoAndSize, which has a DCHECK

for frames with autoresize enabled. This change returns an early error

to avoid getting to the DCHECK and crashing.



Emulation.canEmulate already returns false in this case, so another

solution would be to simply block all commands in the domain. However,

most of the domain does work, so this felt unnecessarily restrictive.



This change is being made in anticipation of future changes that will

make extension popups (which have autoresize enabled) more consistently

show as pages in CDP, therefore increasing the likelihood commands are

called.

entry.title: [android] Don't wipe passwords in SigninManagerImpl if local UPM active
entry.content:
Behavior changes are behind flag. If usesSplitStoresAndUPMForLocal() is

true:

- Passwords are split in 2 separate storages (local and account) and

enabling sync doesn't upload existing passwords. So there's no reason

for SigninManagerImpl to wipe passwords data on sign-in.

- Passwords are managed outside of the browser and are not strictly

tied to its identity model (they are rather tied to the OS-level

identity model). So there's no reason for SigninManagerImpl to wipe

passwords on sign-out.

This CL updates SigninManagerImpl.wipeSyncUserData() not to wipe

passwords.



It also updates the "Keep my data separate" / "Combine my data" dialog

(https://crbug.com/323859372#comment3) not to mention "passwords".

The "Keep my data separate" option exercises wipeSyncUserData().



Bug: 323859372

Change-Id: I9d4fe1193bfeed9e92659cdd28b65741f2b6ad9d

entry.title: Fix HitTestLocation::Intersects(const gfx::QuadF&) false positives
entry.content:
Said function only correctly handle quad vs. rect (the quad being the

"transformed rect" of HitTestLocation) - i.e queries using rectilinear

quads. To avoid false positives, full-blown quad vs. quad is required.



Add gfx::QuadF::IntersectsQuad() and use that. The old code-path for the

rectilinear quad case is kept around although it's quite difficult to

hit for the current caller. The function could potentially be improved

by explicitly handling the case where both quads are rectilinear, but

that is left as future work.



Bug: 40364016

entry.content:

pref value and when there was an error while getting/setting pref.

It then uses those to make sure that migration is only marked as

successful if there were no errors and we got confirmation for every

value we wanted to set.



Additionally it adds unit tests for handling potential failures

when getting/setting pref value in gms.

entry.title: CRD: Ensure no crash when receiving access code twice
entry.content:
This can and will happen when the client tried to connect and it failed,

for example due to a network hickup.



In M121 this lead to crashes (see bug), but due to a code refactoring

this luckely no longer crashes in M122+, so all this commit does is add

an unittest to prevent this from ever crashing again.



Fixed: b/325905707

Test: new unittests

entry.title: [//gpu] Expand tracking of accesses in IOSurfaceImageBacking
entry.content:
This CL expands tracking of accesses (i.e., that concurrent read/write

does not occur unless CONCURRENT_READ_WRITE is supported) to all

representations within IOSurfaceImageBacking that invoke

IOSurfaceImageBacking::{Begin, End}Access(). Concretely, this means the

Dawn and overlay representations.



In addition to more strictly enforcing correctness, this might help

shed more light on concurrent read/write accesses that Dawn's

SharedTextureMemory is currently signaling. I tested this CL locally

with Ganesh and Graphite across a variety of use cases and did not

trigger this CHECK going off.



Bug: 325408101

Change-Id: Ifb87fb36abfda7dd0eecc216d97ff7536f3c9266

entry.title: [Bluetooth] Update policy setting after adapter is ready
entry.content:
It is possible that when Chrome receives the policy update signal, the

Bluetooth adapter is not ready. This would cause the policy setting to

fail and never update to the right settings even after the adapter is

ready.



This patch adds observers to watch the state of the adapter to update

the policy if necessary to fix the issue.



BUG=b:308608134

TEST=tested on marasov with the following steps

1. rmmod btusb.

2. update policy settings in admin.google.com.

3. modprobe btusb.

4. verify the policy is updated.



Change-Id: I55c210e80f3fa1acec0ee8d95cc2d5ac6ad49b2a

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5237976

entry.title: Update android to use androidx_espresso
entry.content:
Androidx_espresso relies on accessibility_test_framework 3.X. However this has a very old protobuf-lite library that is incompatible with our newer protobuf-javalite library.



This change creates a accessibility_test_framework dependency which uses version 4.0, except for two modified source files from 3.X so that Androidx_espresso can use the deprecated methods from 3.X.



Androidx_espresso removed "thatmatchesfirst" so those tests were modified to replicate the test behavior.



Future CL will remove third_party/espresso.

entry.title: [bfcache] Refactor mojo structs for BFCache blockers
entry.content:
This CL creates a mojo struct that represents a source location. The goal is to have only two states when we manage source locations: 1. source location exists 2. no source location at all. Having a struct for source location allows us to make a source location itself nullable (avoiding having optional fields inside) and limit the possible cases to only the two.



Here are the specific changes in this CL:

- Created a new mojom file and defined a struct for source location there.

- BFCache-related structs now use the source location struct in common.



Bug: 324201881

Change-Id: I4061ad708010f895416e5881d46c16ba8a3251d6

entry.title: [Nearby Presence] Override and Implement OnConnectionResult() callback
entry.content:
Context: go/cros-nearby-presence-np-nc-interop



This CL implements `OnConnectionResult()` for NearbyConnectionsManager.

When a Presence client uses `RequestConnectionV3()` on a Presence

device, it can then accept or reject the connection. If it accepts using

`AcceptV3()`, Nearby Connections will return a status through this

`OnConnectionResult()` callback, which populates the `connections_v3_`

map.



Additionally, this implements `OnDisconnected()` which works similarly

to the v1 variant.



Test: unit tests added

Fixed: b/321729748, b/321729753

Change-Id: I862a3dd2ee3152a854c851146cb9910bdfc7e14e

entry.title: [Bluetooth] Implement IsExtendedAdvertisementAvailable in BlueZ
entry.content:
This implements IsExtendedAdvertisementAvailable in BlueZ which allows

applications to determine whether the underlying Bluetooth controller

supports extended advertising features.



One thing that might worth noting is that the application has to call

IsExtendedAdvertisementAvailable after the LEAdvertisingManger is ready.

Otherwise the wrong value might return. This can be fixed by

implementing the notification function to handle the property changed.

entry.title: Fix how `Text::splitText` notifies the change to `LayoutText`

* To notify the correct `TextDiffRange` to `LayoutText`.

The latter is done by extracting a shared logic with

`Text::UpdateTextLayoutObject`, allowing `LayoutText` to use

the information while optimizing.

entry.title: Files app: let NATIVE_PATH show Fusebox volumes
entry.content:
A new comment in filtered_volume_manager.ts discusses 3 volume

categories: nat, fsf or fwf. There's also the 3-valued AllowedPaths enum

and the 3-valued context in which isAllowedVolume is called: (1) with

the #fuse-box-debug flag enabled, (2) without, in lacros and (3)

without, in ash.



We can write out a 3x3 table where the rows are AllowedPaths enum values

and the columns are (1) debug, (2) lacros and (3) ash. Before this

commit, it looked like this:



. debug lacros ash

ANY_PATH nat,fsf,fwf nat,fwf nat,fsf

ANY_PATH_OR_URL nat,fsf,fwf nat,fwf nat,fsf

NATIVE_PATH nat nat,fwf nat



This commit leaves the ANY_PATH and ANY_PATH_OR_URL rows unchanged, but

the NATIVE_PATH row now shows fwf volumes more often. The before/after

diff for this commit is:



. debug lacros ash

NATIVE_PATH:bef nat nat,fwf nat

NATIVE_PATH:aft nat,fwf nat,fwf nat,fwf



In particular, ODFS (OneDrive File System) is an FSP (File System

Provider) volume which is not nat. When showing a browser's "Save As"

dialog, this passes NATIVE_PATH and so, before this commit, "Save As" in

ash would not show any ODFS volume at all. After this commit "Save As"

in ash shows the fwf-ODFS volume (the Fusebox flavor).



After this commit, people can now point the ChromeOS browser at a JPEG

image and "Save As" directly to their ODFS volume, just like how they

could already do so to their Drive volume.



Drive is Google Drive, not Microsoft OneDrive, two similarly named but

different cloud products. Drive has its own VolumeType.DRIVE enum value

and is nat. ODFS (a Google-authored FSP extension for Microsoft's

OneDrive) is VolumeType.PROVIDED (like any other FSP) and comes in fsf

and fwf variants (like any other FSP).



A future commit might simplify further, changing that bottom row to

match the other two rows (every row becomes "nat,fsf,fwf nat,fwf

nat,fsf"), so that the AllowedPaths enum value doesn't matter at all.

But having "in ash" (so prefer fsf) trump NATIVE_PATH (so use fwf, i.e.

kernel-visible) is a bigger, riskier change, so not part of this commit.



Bug: b:320373830

Test: Manual

Change-Id: Idbba17d83359b71c2ae901d8917dce86f78f368a

entry.title: Remove URLLoaderThrottle::Delegate::RestartWithURLResetAndFlags
entry.content:
Remove `defer` from

`URLLoaderThrottle::BeforeWillProcessResponse` and

`URLLoaderThrottle::BeforeWillRedirectRequest`

as they are not used.

This removes `DEFERRED_BEFORE_RESPONSE` as well.



Remove `URLLoaderThrottle::Delegate::RestartWithURLResetAndFlags`,

and instead signal a restart by setting `RestartWithURLReset` to true

in `BeforeWillProcessResponse` or `BeforeWillRedirectRequest`,

because and to clarify `RestartWithURLReset` can be set only

synchronously within these methods.



Remove `pending_restart_flags_`.

(`RestartWithURLResetAndFlags()` was always called with 0)



Remove `throttle_will_start_original_url_`

(always true when `RestartWithURLResetNow()` is called)



Remove `has_pending_restart_`, and use `RestartWithURLReset` local

variables instead, because Before* methods can no longer defer the

loading and thus restarting is processed immediately.



Bug: 325314722

entry.title: CCA: Refactor PTZ control logic
entry.content:
Digital zoom is planned to be controlled using Mojo, which is different

from the existing way to control PTZ using MediaStream API. To handle

both ways of controlling PTZ using the same UI, we add PTZController

interface to let both approaches implement.



In this CL, we create an interface PTZController, and moves the existing

control to a new class MediaStreamPTZController.



Bug: b:315740659

Test: tast run $DUT camera.CCAUIPTZ

entry.title: Revert "[Default Nav Transition] Implement AnimationManager"
entry.content:
This reverts commit 249bf160e0b67010d1ddbd074ecb2df75dfa859b.



Reason for revert: Likely culprit of test failures (see bug)



Original change's description:

> [Default Nav Transition] Implement AnimationManager

>

> Full impl of the AnimationManager interface for mainframe cross-doc

> navigations only. Only the transformational animations are included

> (i.e., layer moving animations). Does not include scrim or cross-fade

> animations. Subframes, same-doc and cross-origin server redirects are

> TODOs.

>

> We use a new hook OnDidNavigate() to observe the finishing of a request

> (committed successfully), and use DidFinishNavigation() to observe the

> non-committed requests (204/205/Download, replaced or cancelled). Using

> a new hook because the OnRenderWidgetHostViewSwapped() timing is too

> late [1].

>

> Edge cases:

> - Another navigation commits while the user is still swiping across the

> screen: synchronously destroy the impl_.

> - Another navigation cancels our navigation and our navigation isn't

> pending-commit. Play the cancel animation to bring back the active

> page.

> - Our navigation cancels other navigations. No action.

> - With NavigationQueuing, a previously pending navigation has committed

> before our navigation commits. No action.

> - Our navigation has committed (so the animation manager is displaying

> the invoke animation / waiting for the new renderer to submit a frame

> / displaying the cross-fade animation) while another navigation

> commits. This can happen while navigation queuing or with a client

> redirect. In this case we synchronously destroy the impl_.

>

> [1]: OnRenderWidgetHostViewSwapped happens during

> RFHManager::CommitPending, and CommitPending happens after

> WCI::DidNavigateMainFramePreCommit [2]. At

> DidNavigateMainFramePreCommit, we will reset the LocalSurfaceId on the

> old View. Because we need to clone the old View's visual state, the

> notification needs to be placed before the LocalSurfaceId is reset.

> [2]: https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:content/browser/renderer_host/navigator.cc;drc=d3dcc876aec63f37b5c9b38281e7485ff24b7bd3;l=511

>

>

> Bug: 1509888

> Change-Id: I8390910b2c43da45655052998d1369dc4b5ba1e7

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5122651

> Commit-Queue: William Liu

> Reviewed-by: Khushal Sagar

> Reviewed-by: Rakina Zata Amni

> Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1262714}



Bug: 1509888, 326151124
